Question: The governor, Nicolás de Ovando y Cáceres, detested this person and obstructed all efforts to rescue him and his men.
Hints: On 30 May 1498, this person left with six ships from Sanlúcar, Spain, for his third trip to the New World.
This person led his fleet to the Portuguese island of Porto Santo, his wife's native land.
The king submitted this person's proposal to his experts, who rejected it.
